main event: A shiny silver oval-shaped object was observed in the sky near Canton, Ohio on May 6, 1957.
interesting points: The object was oval-shaped, measuring 12 inches long by 8 inches wide., The object had a shiny silver color., It was observed for approximately 10 minutes., The object was orbiting with no sound detected., The observer reported no significant disturbances in the surrounding area.
witness description: 2nd Lt. William H. Schreiner, Int Officer
